description: From Old English bales, balais, from Old French balais, from Arabic بَلَخْش‎ (balaḵš), from Persian بلخش‎ (balaxš), a form of بدخش‎ (badaxš, “balas”), related to بدخشان‎ (badaxšân, “Badakhshan”), the region where they are found.

entries.meaning: (archaic, now chiefly attributive) A type of rose-coloured spinel once thought to be a form of ruby.
